Message.Msg: Yes, you are quite right about that, IBM is the best in the history of this country.

Message.Title: Sentiment Index
Message.Msg: What about Sentiment Index provided by IBM?
Rising interest rates is the reason for this statement...The stagnant revenues have been with us for a few quarters.

Greenspan raised interest rates something like 18 consecutive meetings in order to kill "irrational exuberence." He was nothing like Ben Bernanke who has done a nice job of cleaning up the mess left by Mr. Greenspan and the Bush Administration..

Classic shill. If shareholder value goes down, it is somebody else's fault. If it goes up, HEY, GINNY IS A GENIUS AND FIRED ALL THAT DEADWOOD. Cost of borrowing, however, will be going up and that squeezes everything.
Then $10 for India Business Machines Corporation

Topic.Title: Stop Whining... Stop Complaining... Get back to Work...

Message.Msg: The shareholders may be happy to see the next quarter results as a result of current cuts, but low and poor employee morale among the survivors of this cycle cuts = lowered productivity and dis-incentivization = poor company performance in subsequent quarters = steady decline in the company = lowered shareholder value in the long term = unhappy shareholders down the road. Unless you're a day trader interested in short-term gain, the happy smirks will not last too long in subsequent quarters.

Topic.Title: Business Insider Article- Laid Off IBM Employee Says The Company Is Blowing It By Cutting The Wrong People- Julie Bort

Message.Msg: I'm sure the Corporate Communications division at IBM has seen it and if they dared, had passed it up the food chain. In many ways Ginni is stuck between a rock and a hard place, and her extrication strategy is to implement the cuts to take the path of least shareholder resistance. It's not easy being green or being Big Blue, either.
